result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles P. Heller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court authorizes transfer of probation to Outagamie County

miscConds.notes: To be paid to R.S. at a rate of at least $5.00 per month until paid in full.
Maintain FTE/schooling or combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week, or if not, perform 10 hours of community service per week.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department.   DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles P. Heller

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:08 am 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person with Atty James Eby.  
VRCW. 

State moves to: 
Ct. 1 (Criminal Damage to Property)>>AMEND to DC pursuant to 947.01(1). 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: Amended Ct. 1 (DC)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 1 year probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week, or if not, perform 10 hours CS per week; pay $50 restitution to R.S. at rate of at least $5 per month until paid; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to NO jail credit if revoked. 
COURT authorizes transfer of probation to Outagamie County. 

Adj: 10:17 am

No contact with victim(s):  R.S. and Bob; Randy's Bar on 6th Street. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Absolute sobriety from alcohol.
